meanings.definition: To be blessed more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She felt outblessed by her kind neighbor who always helped her.
meanings.sent2: The kind old lady always outblessed others with her generosity.
meanings.sent3: The cat outblessed the dog by finding a sunny spot to nap in.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to outbless each other with their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's smile outblessed the gloomy weather, brightening everyone's day.

meanings.definition: To receive more blessings than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He was outblessed by his friends who showered him with gifts on his birthday.
meanings.sent2: The kind-hearted man always outblessed others with his acts of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The lucky rabbit outblessed the other animals by finding a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent4: The starry night sky seemed to outbless the city lights with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful garden outblessed the noisy streets, offering a serene escape.
